intro: Carallia celebica, commonly known as the Java hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in moist, well-drained soil. Carallia celebica is also used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
